In one article I read, this is how much and more the airlines were charging people to change (or just obtain) their flights out. It was in the Seattle Times, a story about an Afghan immigrant, now U.S. citizen, whose Afghan wife (not U.S. citizen, w/Green Card) went back to Afghanistan to visit her parents with their American citizen children. Her return flight was scheduled for the middle of Sept. (Have to say I don’t how this was the case since Biden reportedly announced at the beginning of the year we were going to be out by the end of August … but anyway,) they wanted something like 10,000 dollars to change the flight. I gather they paid it (or used credit cards?), but then, because of the situation, she wasn’t able to get to the airport in time (or something) – and they wanted something similar in amount again for another seat.  Or some such horror story. That there was radical inflation of the airline tickets. Don’t know if that part has since changed …  sounds like it has … and … unfortunately, haven’t seen news of whether this mother and her U.S. children have even gotten out yet.
But yes, Erik Prince is a “monstrous human.” Think of the gasoline, too, for these flights only carrying a few select and wealthy whatevers (probably war criminals if they’re riding with Erik).
